intro: Rytigynia neglecta var. neglecta, commonly known as the slender false hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically small, with five petals and a prominent yellow or white center, and they bloom in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks.
